intro: Sphacele mandoniana, commonly known as the Mandon's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded pods that resemble bladders, giving it its common name. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Sphacele mandoniana is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
